snippet: American sales for the Volkswagen division have fallen 5.2 percent so far this year, to 374,000 vehicles, leading to the management change.
abstract: Volkswagen, facing stagnating sales in United States even as rest of industry has surged, announces resignation of Jonathan Browning as chief executive of American division; Browning will be replaced by company stalwart Michael Horn.
lead_paragraph: American sales for the Volkswagen division have fallen 5.2 percent so far this year, to 374,000 vehicles, leading to the management change.

headline.main: As Sales Lag, VW Picks a New Leader for U.S.
headline.print_headline: As Sales Lag, VW Picks A New Leader for U.S.
